intro: Palicourea longistipulata subsp. chrysorrhachis, commonly known as golden-stippled palicourea, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves with prominent golden-yellow stipules along the petioles. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically white or pale yellow, adding to its ornamental appeal. This subspecies is valued in horticulture for its attractive foliage and potential medicinal properties.
